title: Turkish police arrest 115 people for planning holiday attacks
snippets: Turkish special police detained more than 100 suspected members of the "Islamic State" terrorist group that they said were planning on carrying out attacks during Christmas and New Year celebrations in the country.
Turkey detains 115 suspected Islamic State members believed planning attacks Reuters

Turkish authorities have detained 115 suspected ISIS members they believe were planning to carry out attacks on Christmas and new year celebrations in the country, the chief prosecutor's office said Thursday.
Raids across Istanbul seize weapons as authorities seek 22 remaining suspects still at large.
Turkish authorities say firearms were seized and efforts to trace further suspected members are continuing.

summary: Turkish authorities have detained 115 suspected members of the Islamic State group accused of planning attacks during Christmas and New Year celebrations. Raids across Istanbul led to the seizure of firearms, and authorities are searching for 22 additional suspects who remain at large. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Athletics sign Tyler Soderstrom to seven year contract extension
snippets: The Athletics and left fielder Tyler Soderstrom reportedly agreed to a seven-year, $86 million contract extension, according to ESPN's Jeff Passan.

The Athletics are paying big bucks to keep an important player in the fold. Left fielder Tyler Soderstrom and the club have agreed to a seven-year, $86-million extension, ESPN’s Jeff Passan reported Thursday. It is the largest guaranteed payout in franchise history, according to Passan. Passan reports there is an eighth-year club option and the deal has escalators that could see Soderstrom earn a maximum of $131 million. Soderstrom, 24, slashed .276/.346/.474 with 25 homers and 93 RBIs last season. The Athletics selected Soderstrom 26th overall in the 2020 draft.
